New Records: Lane Thomas and José Ramírez hit back-to-back homers in the eighth inning, a notable performance but no new records mentioned
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas and José Ramírez hit back-to-back homers in the eighth inning
Junior Caminero had a career-high three doubles for the Rays
Thomas threw out Josh Lowe at home in the fifth
Post-Match Reflections: Lane Thomas said, “Some of our aggressive at-bats today worked out and we scored a lot of runs out of it,”
Thomas also said, “You’ve just got to go have fun out there. It’s a fun game.”
Taylor Walls said, “Junior is super impressive and he’s going to continue to show everyone his tools for years to come,”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians remained three games ahead of second-place Kansas City in the division with 13 games remaining
Cleveland has the best home record in the AL at 44-27 and is 85-64 overall, second in the league to the New York Yankees
The Rays are 5 1/2 games out of the final AL wild-card berth after Minnesota's 11-1 loss to Cincinnati on Saturday
Others: Lane Thomas saved the game by throwing out Josh Lowe at home in the fifth inning
Cantillo (2-3) gave up three hits, walked one and struck out six in five scoreless innings
Steven Kwan (mid-low back tightness) is considered day to day and will not be placed on the injured list
